metadata.title: CVE-2016-1693 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
browser/safe_browsing/srt_field_trial_win.cc in Google Chrome before51.0.2704.63 does not use the HTTPS service on dl.google.com to obtain theSoftware Removal Tool, which allows remote attackers to spoof thechrome_cleanup_tool.exe (aka CCT) file via a man-in-the-middle attack on anHTTP session.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1693` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-browser-l10n - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-chromedriver - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.2704.79-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1242').
